Public Functions

new_Convolve 
 Convolve new_Convolve(int direction,
                       Vector resp,
                       char *instype,
                       float flo,
                       float fhi)
Create a Convolve object. Create a Convolve object from several instrument responses. Convolve is a GMethod object that sequentially convolves or deconvolves its responses with a waveform.

Parameters:
direction - The direction of the operation: -1 to deconvolve, 1 to convolve.
resp - A vector of Response objects.
insytpe - The instrument type.
flo - Apply a cosine taper from 0 to frequency flo.
fhi - Apply a cosine taper from frequency fhi to the nyquist frequency.
Returns:
a Convolve object, or NULL if malloc fails (LogErrorMsg is called).
new_ConvolveOne 
 Convolve new_ConvolveOne(int direction,
                          Response resp,
                          char *instype,
                          float flo,
                          float fhi)
Create a Convolve object. Create a Convolve object from a single instrument response. Convolve is a GMethod object that convolves or deconvolves a response with a waveform.

Parameters:
direction - The direction of the operation: -1 to deconvolve, 1 to convolve.
resp - A Response object.
insytpe - The instrument type.
flo - Apply a cosine taper from 0 to frequency flo.
fhi - Apply a cosine taper from frequency fhi to the nyquist frequency.
Returns:
a Convolve object, or NULL if malloc fails (LogErrorMsg is called).

 Convolve new_Convolve_fromString(char *s)
